snippet.name: Acyclicity
snippet.statement: Description: Used to verbalize acyclic ring constraint in the majority of cases. Format: No {0} may cycle back to itself via one or more traversals through {1}
snippet.unformattedSnippet: no {0} may cycle back to itself via one or more traversals through {1}

snippet.name: AcyclicityWithRoleNumbers
snippet.statement: Description: Used to verbalize acyclic ring constraints where more than two roles have a role player of the constrained type. Format: No {0} may cycle back to itself via one or more instances of the role pair: roles {2} and {3} of {1}
snippet.unformattedSnippet: no {0} may cycle back to itself via one or more instances of the role pair:roles {2} and {3} of {1}

snippet.name: AggregateBagProjection
snippet.statement: Description: Leave aggregate parameter inputs as a bag of values. Format: each {0}

snippet.name: AggregateParameterComplexAggregationContextListClose
snippet.statement: Description: The closing of a composite aggregation list. Format: combination

snippet.name: AggregateParameterComplexAggregationContextListOpen
snippet.statement: Description:The opening of a composite aggregation list. Format: each

snippet.name: AggregateParameterComplexAggregationContextListSeparator
snippet.statement: Description: The separator of a composite aggregation list. Format: ,

snippet.name: AggregateParameterDecorator
snippet.statement: Description: Decorate a single or complex aggregation context. Format: {0} of {1}

snippet.name: AggregateParameterSimpleAggregationContext
snippet.statement: Description: Provide a description of a single aggregation context. Format: each {0}

snippet.name: AggregateSetProjection
snippet.statement: Description: Limit values from an aggregate parameter input to distinct values. Format: each distinct {0}

snippet.name: AtMostOneQuantifier
snippet.statement: Description: Used for 'at most one' before an object name to signify the quantity may only be zero or one. Format: at most one {0}

snippet.name: AtMostOneTypedOccurrence
snippet.statement: Description: Used for a single-role frequency constraint with min=max=1. Format: at most one {0}

snippet.name: ChainedListCollapsedSeparator
snippet.statement: Description: The text for a collapsed separator in a chained list. Generally just a space.

snippet.name: ChainedListComplexRestrictionBackReferenceSeparator
snippet.statement: Description: A separator for a chained list where the chained restriction introduces additional fact statements and the start of the next statement is a back reference. See ChainedListComplexRestrictionSeparator for additional comments. Format: \n

snippet.name: ChainedListComplexRestrictionCollapsedLeadSeparator
snippet.statement: Description: Used in place of the ChainedListComplexRestrictionSeparator if the lead role player of a chained list is the same as the previous statement. Chained lists can collapse the lead role if the list type is listed in the RolePathCollapsibleLeadDirective snippet. Format: \n\t and

snippet.name: ChainedListComplexRestrictionSeparator
snippet.statement: Description: A separator for a chained list where the chained restriction introduces additional fact statements. Note that the complex restriction separator is not used before a TailListOpen of an operator separated list, which is any split list not specific in the RolePathHeaderListDirective snippet. Format: \n\t where

snippet.name: ChainedListLocalRestrictionBackReferenceSeparator
snippet.statement: Description: A separator for a chained list where the chained restriction applies only to elements contained in the preceding fact statement and the start of the next statement is a back reference.

snippet.name: ChainedListLocalRestrictionSeparator
snippet.statement: Description: A separator for a chained list where the chained restriction applies only to elements contained in the preceding fact statement. Format: where

snippet.name: ChainedListOpen
snippet.statement: Description: The opening text for a chained list.

snippet.name: ChainedListTopLevelComplexRestrictionBackReferenceSeparator
snippet.statement: Description: The same as ChainedListComplexRestrictionBackReferenceSeparator, except used for a top-level restriction. If the non-top-level separator includes an indentation, then this separator should omit the indent. Format: \n and

snippet.name: ChainedListTopLevelComplexRestrictionCollapsedLeadSeparator
snippet.statement: Description: The same as ChainedListComplexRestrictionCollapsedLeadSeparator, except used for a top-level restriction. If the non-top-level separator includes an indentation, then this separator should omit the indent. Format: \n and

snippet.name: ChainedListTopLevelComplexRestrictionSeparator
snippet.statement: Description: The same as ChainedListComplexRestrictionSeparator, except used for a top-level restriction. If the non-top-level separator includes an indentation, then this separator should omit the indent. Format: \n where

snippet.name: CloseVerbalizationSentence
snippet.statement: Description: Text used to close a verbalized sentence. Format: .

snippet.name: CombinationIdentifier
snippet.statement: Description: Verbalizes a combination. Format: {0} combination

snippet.name: CombinationUniqueness
snippet.statement: Description: Verbalizes uniqueness of a combination. Format: {0} combination is unique

snippet.name: CombinedObjectAndInstance
snippet.statement: Description: Used to combine an object and an instance. Format: {0} {1}

snippet.name: CombinedObjectAndInstanceTypeMissing
snippet.statement: Description: Used to say an object and instance combination is missing. Format: Missing {0}

snippet.name: CompactSimpleListClose
snippet.statement: Description: Text used at the end of a compact simple list.

snippet.name: CompactSimpleListFinalSeparator
snippet.statement: Description: Used to separate the last two items in a compact simple list. Format: ,

snippet.name: CompactSimpleListOpen
snippet.statement: Description: Text used at the beginning of a compact simple list.

snippet.name: CompactSimpleListPairSeparator
snippet.statement: Description: Used to separate items in a compact simple list. Format: ,

snippet.name: CompactSimpleListSeparator
snippet.statement: Description: Used to separate items in a compact simple list. Format: ,

snippet.name: CompatibleTypesIdentityInequalityOperator
snippet.statement: Description: Used to specify that two instances of compatible types are not the same instance. Format: that {0} is not that {1}

snippet.name: CompoundListClose
snippet.statement: Description: Text that is at the end of a compound list.

snippet.name: CompoundListFinalSeparator
snippet.statement: Description: Used after the last item listed in a compound list. Format: ;

snippet.name: CompoundListOpen
snippet.statement: Description: Text that is at the beginning of a compound list.

snippet.name: CompoundListPairSeparator
snippet.statement: Description: Used to separate items in a compound list. Format: ;

snippet.name: CompoundListSeparator
snippet.statement: Description: Used to separate items in a compound list. Format: ;

snippet.name: Conditional
snippet.statement: Description: Verbalizes a simple conditional statement. Format: if {0} then {1}

snippet.name: ConditionalMultiLine
ConditionalMultiLineIndented
ConstraintProvidesPreferredIdentifier
snippet.statement: Description: Verbalizes the preferred identifier for an object. Format: this association with {0}provides the preferred identification scheme for {1}
snippet.unformattedSnippet: this association with {0} provides the preferred identification scheme for {1}

snippet.name: ContextCombinationAssociation
snippet.statement: Description: Verbalizes a range of combination occurrences for a specified type where the combination has been previous specified. Format: that combination is associated with {1} in this context
snippet.unformattedSnippet: that combination is associated with {0} in this context

snippet.name: ContextCombinationOccurrence
snippet.statement: Description: Verbalizes a range of combination occurrences where the combination has been previous specified. Format: that combination occurs {1} in this context
snippet.unformattedSnippet: that combination occurs {0} in this context

snippet.name: DefiniteArticle
snippet.statement: Description: Used for 'that' before an object name to signify a back reference to a uniquely qualified object type.

snippet.name: DerivationNoteVerbalization
snippet.statement: Description: Verbalizes the informal note specified for an element derivation rule. Format: Derivation Note: {0}

snippet.name: DescriptionVerbalization
snippet.statement: Description: Verbalizes the text specified for an element description. Format: Informal Description: {0}

snippet.name: EachInstanceQuantifier
snippet.statement: Description: Verbalizes an instance of the specified object may occur at most one time. Format: each instance of {0} occurs only once
snippet.unformattedSnippet: each instance of {0} occurs only once

snippet.name: EntityTypeVerbalization
snippet.statement: Description: Verbalizes an object as being an entity type. Format: {0} is an entity type

snippet.name: Equality
snippet.statement: Description: Used to verbalize a simple equality constraint. Format: {0} if and only if {1}

snippet.name: EqualsListClose
snippet.statement: Description: Text that is at the end of an equals list.

snippet.name: EqualsListFinalSeparator
snippet.statement: Description: Used between the last two items in an equals list. Format: =

snippet.name: EqualsListOpen
snippet.statement: Description: Text that is at the beginning of an equals list.

snippet.name: EqualsListPairSeparator
snippet.statement: Description: Used to separate items in an equals list. Format: =

snippet.name: EqualsListSeparator
snippet.statement: Description: Used to separate items in an equals list. Format: =

snippet.name: ErrorClosePrimaryReport
snippet.statement: Description: Close a primary error report opened with ErrorOpenPrimaryReport

snippet.name: ErrorCloseSecondaryReport
snippet.statement: Description: Close a secondary error report opened with ErrorOpenSecondaryReport.

snippet.name: ErrorOpenPrimaryReport
snippet.statement: Description: Used to open a primary error report. Primary error reports block further verbalization.

snippet.name: ErrorOpenSecondaryReport
ErrorPrimary
ErrorSecondary
snippet.statement: Description: Used to verbalize a single secondary error. Format: Model Error: {0}

snippet.name: ExactlyOneQuantifier
snippet.statement: Description: Used for 'exactly one' before an object name to signify the quantity may only be one. Format: exactly one {0}

snippet.name: ExactlyOneTypedOccurrence
snippet.statement: Description: Used for a fallback uniqueness verbalization, or for a frequency constraint with min=max=1. Format: exactly one {0}

snippet.name: ExactlyOneUntypedOccurrence
snippet.statement: Description: Used for a fallback uniqueness verbalization, or for a frequency constraint with min=max=1. Format: exactly once

snippet.name: ExclusionBinaryLeadReading
snippet.statement: Description: Used to verbalize an exclusion constraint, on a binary lead reading. Format: No {0} the same {1}

snippet.name: ExclusionCombined
snippet.statement: Description: Used to combine the first role player and the roles played for an Exclusion constraint (i.e: No Person authored and reviewed). Format: {0} {1}

snippet.name: ExistenceImplicationOperator
snippet.statement: Description: Verbalizes an existence condition and a consequent. Format: there is {0} such that {1}

snippet.name: ExistentialQuantifier
snippet.statement: Description: Used for 'some' before an object name to signify the context in which the object is being referred to. Format: some {0}

snippet.name: FactTypeInstanceBlockEnd
snippet.statement: Description: Formatted single snippet used to end a sample population verbalization of fact types block.

snippet.name: FactTypeInstanceBlockStart
snippet.statement: Description: Text and formatting to begin a sample population verbalization of fact types block. Format: Examples:

snippet.name: FactTypeInstanceIdentifier
snippet.statement: Description: The text describing the identifier for an objectified FactType instance with an external identifier. Format: Identifier:

snippet.name: FactTypeListClose
snippet.statement: Description: Text used to close the sample population verbalization list.

snippet.name: FactTypeListFinalSeparator
snippet.statement: Description: Text used to separate the last two items in a sample population verbalization list. Format:

snippet.name: FactTypeListOpen
snippet.statement: Description: Text and formatting to begin a sample population verbalization basic predicate text.Format: FactTypes:

snippet.name: FactTypeListPairSeparator
snippet.statement: Description: Text used to separate items in a sample population verbalization list. Format:

snippet.name: FactTypeListSeparator
snippet.statement: Description: Text used to separate items in a sample population verbalization list. Format:

snippet.name: ForEachCompactQuantifier
snippet.statement: Description: Verbalizes for each instance of an object, some rule applies to those instances. Format: for each {0}, {1}

snippet.name: ForEachIndentedQuantifier
snippet.statement: Description: Verbalizes for each instance of an object then creates a line break where the rules that apply to those instances are listed. Format: for each {0}, \n{1}

snippet.name: ForEachNegatableCompactQuantifier
ForEachNegatableIndentedQuantifier
FrequencyPopulation
snippet.statement: Description: Used as for the main body text of a frequency constraint on one FactType. Format: each {0} in the population of {1} occurs there {2} times
snippet.unformattedSnippet: each {0} in the population of “{1}” occurs there {2}

snippet.name: FrequencyRangeExact
snippet.statement: Description: Used for a frequency range where both the min and max values the same Format: exactly {0}

snippet.name: FrequencyRangeMaxUnbounded
snippet.statement: Description: Used for a frequency range where both the max value is unbounded. Format: at least {0}

snippet.name: FrequencyRangeMinAndMax
snippet.statement: Description: Used for a frequency range where both the min and max values are specified and different. Format: at least {0} and at most {1}

snippet.name: FrequencyRangeMinUnbounded
snippet.statement: Description: Used for a frequency range where the min value is less than 2. Format: at most {1}

snippet.name: FrequencyTypedOccurrences
snippet.statement: Description: Used to specify an instance count or range for a specific object type. Format: {1} instances of {0}

snippet.name: FrequencyUntypedOccurrences
snippet.statement: Description: Used to specify an instance count or range using an untyped occurrence phrase Format: {0} times

snippet.name: FullFactTypeDerivation
snippet.statement: Description: Used to specify a fully derived fact type with its derivation rule. Format: *{0} if and only if {1}

snippet.name: FullSubtypeDerivation
snippet.statement: Description: Used to specify a fully derived subtype derivation rule. Format: each {0} is {1}

snippet.name: GroupEquality
snippet.statement: Description: Assert group equality. Format: all or none of the following hold: {0}
snippet.unformattedSnippet: all or none of the following hold: {0}

snippet.name: GroupExclusion
snippet.statement: Description: Assert group exclusion. Format: at most one of the following holds: {0}
snippet.unformattedSnippet: at most one of the following holds: {0}

snippet.name: GroupExclusiveOr
snippet.statement: Description: Assert group exclusive-or. Format: exactly one of the following holds: {0}
snippet.unformattedSnippet: exactly one of the following holds: {0}

snippet.name: HeadVariableProjection
snippet.statement: Description: Project a calculation or constant value onto a head variable. Format: {0} = {1}

snippet.name: HyphenBoundPredicatePart
snippet.statement: Description: Format string to combine predicate text from hyphen binding with the replacement field. Format: {0}{{0}}{1}

snippet.name: IdentityEqualityListClose
snippet.statement: Description: Text that is at the end of an identity equality list.

snippet.name: IdentityEqualityListFinalSeparator
snippet.statement: Description: Used between the last two items in an identity equality list. Format: that is a

snippet.name: IdentityEqualityListOpen
snippet.statement: Description: Text that is at the beginning of an identity equality list.

snippet.name: IdentityEqualityListPairSeparator
snippet.statement: Description: Used to separate items in an identity equality list. Format: that is a

snippet.name: IdentityEqualityListSeparator
snippet.statement: Description: Used to separate items in an identity equality list. Format: that is a

snippet.name: IdentityReferenceQuantifier
snippet.statement: Description: Used for 'the same' before an object name to signify exactly which object is being reference. Format: the same {0}

snippet.name: ImpersonalIdentityCorrelation
ImpersonalLeadIdentityCorrelation
snippet.statement: Description: A form of ImpersonalIdentityCorrelation for lead role scenarios. Relate two variables of different types that represent the same instance where the first variable is an impersonal object type. Format: {1} is {0} that

snippet.name: ImpersonalPronoun
snippet.statement: Description: Use in place of a role player name to reference an impersonal object type with a clear antecedent.

snippet.name: ImpliedModalNecessityOperator
snippet.statement: Description: Used to define the strength of the constraint. Alethic, positive adds nothing before an object name. Deontic, positive adds 'it is obligatory that' before an object name. Alethic, negative adds 'it is impossible that' before an object name. Deontic, negative adds 'it is forbidden that' before an object name. Format for alethic and positive: {0} Format for deontic and positive: it is obligatory that {0} Format for alethic and negative: it is impossible that {0} Format for deontic and negative: it is forbidden that {0}

snippet.name: IndentedCompoundListClose
snippet.statement: Description: Text that is at the end of an indented compound list.

snippet.name: IndentedCompoundListFinalSeparator
snippet.statement: Description: Used to separate the last two items in an indented compound list. Format: ;

snippet.name: IndentedCompoundListOpen
snippet.statement: Description: Text that is at the beginning of an indented compound list. Format: \n

snippet.name: IndentedCompoundListPairSeparator
snippet.statement: Description: Used to separate items in an indented compound list. Format: ;

snippet.name: IndentedCompoundListSeparator
snippet.statement: Description: Used to separate items in an indented compound list. Format: ;

snippet.name: IndentedListClose
snippet.statement: Description: Text used at the end of an indented list.

snippet.name: IndentedListFinalSeparator
snippet.statement: Description: Used to separate the last two items in an indented list. Format: and

snippet.name: IndentedListOpen
snippet.statement: Description: Text used at the beginning of an indented list. Format: \n

snippet.name: IndentedListPairSeparator
snippet.statement: Description: Used to separate items in an indented list. Format: and

snippet.name: IndentedListSeparator
snippet.statement: Description: Used to separate items in an indented list. Format: and

snippet.name: IndentedLogicalAndListClose
snippet.statement: Description: Text used at the end of an indented logical and list.

snippet.name: IndentedLogicalAndListFinalSeparator
snippet.statement: Description: Used to separate the last two items in an indented logical and list. Format: and that

snippet.name: IndentedLogicalAndListOpen
snippet.statement: Description: Text used at the beginning of an indented logical and list. Format: \n

snippet.name: IndentedLogicalAndListPairSeparator
snippet.statement: Description: Used to separate items in an indented logical and list. Format: and that

snippet.name: IndentedLogicalAndListSeparator
snippet.statement: Description: Used to separate items in an indented logical and list. Format: and that

snippet.name: IndentedLogicalOrListClose
snippet.statement: Description: Text used at the end of an indented logical or list.

snippet.name: IndentedLogicalOrListFinalSeparator
snippet.statement: Description: Used to separate the last two items in an indented logical or list. Format: or

snippet.name: IndentedLogicalOrListOpen
snippet.statement: Description: Text used at the beginning of an indented logical or list. Format: \n

snippet.name: IndentedLogicalOrListPairSeparator
snippet.statement: Description: Used to separate items in an indented logical or list. Format: or

snippet.name: IndentedLogicalOrListSeparator
snippet.statement: Description: Used to separate items in an indented logical or list. Format: or

snippet.name: IndependentVerbalization
snippet.statement: Description: Verbalizes an object as being independent. Format: {0} is independent (it may have instances that play no other roles)
snippet.unformattedSnippet: {0} is independent (it may have instances that play no other roles)

snippet.name: InQuantifier
snippet.statement: Description: Used to verbalize [RolePlayer in Fact], e.g. Person in Person has Age. Format: {0} in {1}

snippet.name: LogicalAndOperator
snippet.statement: Description: Used to 'and' together exactly two other snippets. Format: {0} and {1}

snippet.name: MinClosedMaxClosed
snippet.statement: Description: Used to verbalize a range inclusion with the minimum bound closed and the maximum bound closed. Format: at least {0} to at most {1}

snippet.name: MinClosedMaxOpen
snippet.statement: Description: Used to verbalize a range inclusion with the minimum bound closed and the maximum bound open. Format: at least {0} to below {1}

snippet.name: MinClosedMaxUnbounded
snippet.statement: Description: Used to verbalize a range inclusion with the minimum bound closed and the maximum unbounded. Format: at least {0}

snippet.name: MinOpenMaxClosed
snippet.statement: Description: Used to verbalize a range inclusion with the minimum bound open and the maximum bound closed. Format: above {0} to at most {1}

snippet.name: MinOpenMaxOpen
snippet.statement: Description: Used to verbalize a range inclusion with the minimum bound open and the maximum bound open. Format: above {0} to below {1}

snippet.name: MinOpenMaxUnbounded
snippet.statement: Description: Used to verbalize a range inclusion with the minimum bound open and the maximum unbounded. Format: above {0}

snippet.name: MinUnboundedMaxClosed
snippet.statement: Description: Used to verbalize a range inclusion with the minimum unbounded and the maximum bound closed. Format: at most {1}

snippet.name: MinUnboundedMaxOpen
snippet.statement: Description: Used to verbalize a range inclusion with the minimum unbounded and the maximum bound open. Format: below {1}

snippet.name: ModalNecessityOperator
snippet.statement: Description: Used to define the strength of the constraint. Alethic adds 'it is necessary that' before an object name. Deontic adds 'it is obligatory that' before an object name. Format for alethic: it is necessary that {0} Format for deontic: it is obligatory that {0}

snippet.name: ModalPossibilityOperator
snippet.statement: Description: Used to define the strength of the constraint. Alethic, positive adds 'it is possible that' before an object name. Deontic, positive adds 'it is permitted that' before an object name. Alethic, negative adds 'it is impossible that' before an object name. Deontic, negative adds 'it is forbidden that' before an object name. Format for alethic and positive: it is possible that {0} Format for deontic and positive: it is permitted that {0} Format for alethic and negative: it is impossible that {0} Format for deontic and negative: it is forbidden that {0}

snippet.name: ModelVerbalization
snippet.statement: Description: Format string to verbalize the model element. Replacement field {0} is the Model name, and {1} is the guid id for the model.

snippet.name: MoreThanOneQuantifier
snippet.statement: Description: Used for 'more than one' before an object name to define quantity as more than one. Format: more than one {0}

snippet.name: MultilineIndentedCompoundListClose
snippet.statement: Description: Text used at the end of an indented compound list. Format:

snippet.name: MultilineIndentedCompoundListFinalSeparator
snippet.statement: Description: Used to separate the last two items in an indented compound list. Format: ;

snippet.name: MultilineIndentedCompoundListOpen
snippet.statement: Description: Text used at the beginning of an indented compound list with one item on each line.

snippet.name: MultilineIndentedCompoundListPairSeparator
snippet.statement: Description: Used to separate items in an indented compound list. Format: ;

snippet.name: MultilineIndentedCompoundListSeparator
snippet.statement: Description: Used to separate items in an indented compound list. Format: ;

snippet.name: MultiValueValueConstraint
snippet.statement: Description: Used to verbalize a value range constraint with multiple values. Format: the possible values of {0} are {1}

snippet.name: NegatedAndLeadListOpen
snippet.unformattedSnippet: at least one of the following is false:

snippet.name: NegatedAndNestedListCollapsedOpen
snippet.unformattedSnippet: at least one of the following is false:

snippet.name: NegatedAndNestedListOpen
snippet.unformattedSnippet: at least one of the following is false:

snippet.name: NegatedAndTailListCollapsedOpen
snippet.unformattedSnippet: at least one of the following is false:

snippet.name: NegatedAndTailListOpen
snippet.unformattedSnippet: at least one of the following is false:

snippet.name: NegatedOrLeadListOpen
snippet.unformattedSnippet: all of the following are false:

snippet.name: NegatedOrNestedListCollapsedOpen
snippet.unformattedSnippet: all of the following are false:

snippet.name: NegatedOrNestedListOpen
snippet.unformattedSnippet: all of the following are false:

snippet.name: NegatedOrTailListCollapsedOpen
snippet.unformattedSnippet: all of the following are false:

snippet.name: NegatedOrTailListOpen
snippet.unformattedSnippet: all of the following are false:

snippet.name: NegatedVariableExistence
snippet.statement: Description: Assert variable non-existence for an a previous declared variable in an existence statement. Note that VariableExistence can be used with a negated quantifier if the negated variable has not been previously introduced. Format: {0} does not exist

snippet.name: NegatedXorLeadListOpen
snippet.unformattedSnippet: either none or many of the following are true:

snippet.name: NegatedXorNestedListCollapsedOpen
snippet.unformattedSnippet: either none or many of the following are true:

snippet.name: NegatedXorNestedListOpen
snippet.unformattedSnippet: either none or many of the following are true:

snippet.name: NegatedXorTailListCollapsedOpen
snippet.unformattedSnippet: either none or many of the following are true:

snippet.name: NegatedXorTailListOpen
snippet.unformattedSnippet: either none or many of the following are true:

snippet.name: NegativeReadingForUnaryOnlyDisjunctiveMandatory
snippet.statement: Description: Used to verbalize that an object is not included in a set. Format: some {0} participates in none of the following:{1}
snippet.unformattedSnippet: some {0} participates in none of the following:{1}

snippet.name: NonTextInstanceValue
snippet.statement: Description: Used to output a non-text instance value. Format: {0}

snippet.name: NotesVerbalization
snippet.statement: Description: Verbalizes the text specified for a model note. Format: Notes: {0}

snippet.name: ObjectifiesFactTypeVerbalization
snippet.statement: Description: Verbalizes the objectification made for a FactType. Format: {0} objectifies "{1}"

snippet.name: ObjectType
snippet.statement: Description: Verbalizes an object. {0} is the name, {1} is the guid id for the element

snippet.name: ObjectTypeInstanceListClose
snippet.statement: Description: Text used to close the sample population verbalization list. Format: .

snippet.name: ObjectTypeInstanceListFinalSeparator
snippet.statement: Description: Text used to separate the last two items in a sample population verbalization list, or object types. Format: ,

snippet.name: ObjectTypeInstanceListOpen
snippet.statement: Description: Text and formatting to begin a sample population verbalization of object types block. Format: Examples:

snippet.name: ObjectTypeInstanceListPairSeparator
snippet.statement: Description: Text used to separate items in a sample population verbalization list. Format: ,

snippet.name: ObjectTypeInstanceListSeparator
snippet.statement: Description: Text used to separate items in a sample population verbalization list. Format: ,

snippet.name: ObjectTypeMissing
snippet.statement: Description: Verbalizes an object type as being missing.

snippet.name: ObjectTypeWithSubscript
snippet.statement: Description: Verbalizes an object type with a subscript. {0} is the name, {1} is the guid id for the element, {2} is the subscript

snippet.name: OccursInPopulation
snippet.unformattedSnippet: in each population of {1}, {0} occurs at most once

snippet.name: OneQuantifier
PartialFactTypeDerivation
snippet.statement: Description: Used to specify a partially derived fact type with its derivation rule. Format: +{0} if {1}

snippet.name: PeriodSeparator
snippet.statement: Description: Used to delimit two snippet replacements by a snippet. Format: {0}.{1}

snippet.name: PersonalIdentityCorrelation
PersonalLeadIdentityCorrelation
snippet.statement: Description: A form of PersonalIdentityCorrelation for lead role scenarios. Relate two variables of different types that represent the same instance where the first variable is an personal object type. Format: {1} is {0} who

snippet.name: PersonalPronoun
snippet.statement: Description: Use in place of a role player name to reference a personal object type with a clear antecedent.

snippet.name: PortableDataTypeVerbalization
snippet.statement: Description: Verbalizes an object's portable data type. Format: Portable data type: {0}

snippet.name: PredicatePart
snippet.statement: Description: Format string to decorate predicate text in between replacement fields. Must contain a {{0}}. Replacement field {0} is the FactType name, and {1} is the guid id for the element.

snippet.name: QueryNamedParameter
snippet.statement: Description: Describe a query parameter with an associated name. Format: {0}=name, {1}=type name

snippet.name: QueryParameterContainer
snippet.statement: Description: Outer container for listing query parameters. Used as part of a query verbalization. Format: given {0}

snippet.name: QueryUnnamedParameter
snippet.statement: Description: Describe a query parameter with no associated name. Format: given {0}

snippet.name: QueryVerbalization
snippet.statement: Description: Root verbalization for a query. Containers a parameter (defined with QueryParameterContainer if present) and projection lists plus the derivation rule. Format: {0}select {1} where {2}

snippet.name: ReferenceModeVerbalization
snippet.statement: Description: Verbalizes the mode in which an object is referenced. Format: Reference Mode: {0}

snippet.name: ReferenceScheme
snippet.statement: Description: Used to enclose and format a reference scheme replacement in brackets. Format: {0}({1})

snippet.name: ReferenceSchemeVerbalization
snippet.statement: Description: Verbalizes the way in which an object is referenced. Format: Reference Scheme: {0}

snippet.name: ReflexivePronoun
snippet.statement: Description: Use in place of a role player name to refer to an object type with a clear antecedent.

snippet.name: ReflexiveQuantifier
snippet.statement: Description: Used in place of a reflexive pronoun when an antecedent is not guaranteed. Format: {0} itself

snippet.name: RolePathCollapsibleLeadDirective
snippet.statement: Description: Specify a space-separated list of items to determine if a list style supports collapsing a repeated lead role. Allowed values are {Chain, And, Or, Xor, !And, !Or, !Xor, !Chain}. The !Chain directive here applies to the long form of negation, not the inlined form where the verbose negation constructs are not used. A collapsed lead completely eliminates a lead role player. For example, '... Person has FirstName and has LastName', with Person eliminated from the second fact type rendering. Format: And Or Chain

snippet.name: RolePathCollapsibleListOpenForBackReferenceDirective
snippet.statement: Description: Specify a space-separated list of items to determine if the first item in a list style supports collapsing to allow a back reference. The allowed values here are the same as the RolePathCollapsibleLeadDirective and should not intersect the values used for the RolePathHeaderListDirective. A back reference uses a personal or impersonal pronoun in place of a restatement of the lead role player. The back reference must immediately follow the preceding noun. This directive allows a backreference to be used by replacing the *[Tail|Nested]ListOpen snippets with the *[Tail|Nested]ListCollapsedOpen snippets. Lead list types do not support back referencing. Format: And Or Chain

snippet.name: RolePathHeaderListDirective
snippet.statement: Description: Specify a space-separated list of items to determine if split lists are rendered as integrated or separate blocks. Allowed values are {And, Or, Xor, !And, !Or, !Xor}. Format: !And !Or Xor !Xor

snippet.name: RolePathListCloseOutdentSnippets
snippet.statement: Description: A space separated list of list closure snippet names from this enum that reverse an indentation. Trailing outdents can be tracked specially during formatting so that external text or outer list separator and close elements on the same line as the outdent keeps the same indentation level. Format: ChainedListClose NegatedChainedListClose AndTailListClose AndNestedListClose NegatedAndLeadListClose NegatedAndTailListClose NegatedAndNestedListClose OrTailListClose OrNestedListClose NegatedOrLeadListClose NegatedOrTailListClose NegatedOrNestedListClose XorLeadListClose XorTailListClose XorNestedListClose NegatedXorLeadListClose NegatedXorTailListClose NegatedXorNestedListClose
snippet.unformattedSnippet: ChainedListClose NegatedChainedListClose AndTailListClose AndNestedListClose NegatedAndLeadListClose NegatedAndTailListClose NegatedAndNestedListClose OrTailListClose OrNestedListClose NegatedOrLeadListClose NegatedOrTailListClose NegatedOrNestedListClose XorLeadListClose XorTailListClose XorNestedListClose NegatedXorLeadListClose NegatedXorTailListClose NegatedXorNestedListClose

snippet.name: RolePathOutdentAwareTrailingListSnippets
snippet.statement: Description: A space separated list of list separators and close elements that must be placed before any active trailing outdent snippets. Format: NegatedAndLeadListSeparator NegatedAndNestedListSeparator NegatedAndTailListSeparator NegatedOrLeadListSeparator NegatedOrNestedListSeparator NegatedOrTailListSeparator XorLeadListSeparator XorNestedListSeparator XorTailListSeparator NegatedXorLeadListSeparator NegatedXorNestedListSeparator NegatedXorTailListSeparator
snippet.unformattedSnippet: NegatedAndLeadListSeparator NegatedAndNestedListSeparator NegatedAndTailListSeparator NegatedOrLeadListSeparator NegatedOrNestedListSeparator NegatedOrTailListSeparator XorLeadListSeparator XorNestedListSeparator XorTailListSeparator NegatedXorLeadListSeparator NegatedXorNestedListSeparator NegatedXorTailListSeparator

snippet.name: SameTypeIdentityInequalityOperator
snippet.statement: Description: Used to specify that two instances of the same type are not the same instance. Format: {0} is not {1}

snippet.name: SelfReference
snippet.statement: Description: Allows the snippet replacement to verbalize itself. Format: {0}

snippet.name: SimpleListClose
snippet.statement: Description: Text used at the end of a simple list.

snippet.name: SimpleListFinalSeparator
snippet.statement: Description: Used to separate the final item in simple list. Format: , and

snippet.name: SimpleListOpen
snippet.statement: Description: Text used at the end of a simple list.

snippet.name: SimpleListPairSeparator
snippet.statement: Description: Used to separate items in simple list with two items. Format: and

snippet.name: SimpleListSeparator
snippet.statement: Description: Used to separate items in simple list. Format: ,

snippet.name: SimpleLogicalAndListClose
snippet.statement: Description: Text used at the end of a simple logical and list.

snippet.name: SimpleLogicalAndListFinalSeparator
snippet.statement: Description: Used to separate the last two items in a simple logical and list. Format: and

snippet.name: SimpleLogicalAndListOpen
snippet.statement: Description: Text used at the beginning of a simple logical and list.

snippet.name: SimpleLogicalAndListPairSeparator
snippet.statement: Description: Used to separate items in a simple logical and list. Format: and

snippet.name: SimpleLogicalAndListSeparator
snippet.statement: Description: Used to separate items in a simple logical and list. Format: and

snippet.name: SimpleLogicalOrListClose
snippet.statement: Description: Text used at the end of a simple logical or list.

snippet.name: SimpleLogicalOrListFinalSeparator
snippet.statement: Description: Used to separate the last two items in a simple logical or list. Format: or

snippet.name: SimpleLogicalOrListOpen
snippet.statement: Description: Text used at the beginning of a simple logical or list.

snippet.name: SimpleLogicalOrListPairSeparator
snippet.statement: Description: Used to separate items in a simple logical or list. Format: or

snippet.name: SimpleLogicalOrListSeparator
snippet.statement: Description: Used to separate items in a simple logical or list. Format: or

snippet.name: SingleValueValueConstraint
snippet.statement: Description: Used to verbalize a value range constraint with one range, where the min value is equal to the max value. Format: the possible value of {0} is {1}

snippet.name: StronglyIntransitiveConsequent
snippet.statement: Description: Used to verbalize a strongly intransitive ring constraint. Format: it is not true that {0} is indirectly related to {1} by repeatedly applying this fact type
snippet.unformattedSnippet: it is not true that {0} is indirectly related to {1} by repeatedly applying this fact type

snippet.name: SubtypeMetaReading
snippet.statement: Description: Used to describe the relationship between a Subtype and its Supertype at the meta level (i.e: Each Man is an instance of Person). Format: {0}=subtype, {1}=supertype, {2}=SubtypeFact identifier

snippet.name: TextInstanceValue
snippet.statement: Description: Used to output a text instance value. Format: '{0}'

snippet.name: TopLevelIndentedLogicalAndListClose
snippet.statement: Description: Text used at the end of a top level indented logical and list.

snippet.name: TopLevelIndentedLogicalAndListFinalSeparator
snippet.statement: Description: Used to separate the last two items in a top level indented logical and list. Format: \n and that

snippet.name: TopLevelIndentedLogicalAndListOpen
snippet.statement: Description: Text used at the beginning of a top level indented logical and list.

snippet.name: TopLevelIndentedLogicalAndListPairSeparator
snippet.statement: Description: Used to separate items in a top level indented logical and list. Format: \n and that

snippet.name: TopLevelIndentedLogicalAndListSeparator
snippet.statement: Description: Used to separate items in a top level indented logical and list. Format: \n and that

snippet.name: TopLevelIndentedLogicalOrListClose
snippet.statement: Description: Text used at the end of a top level indented logical or list.

snippet.name: TopLevelIndentedLogicalOrListFinalSeparator
snippet.statement: Description: Used to separate the last two items in a top level indented logical or list. Format: \n or

snippet.name: TopLevelIndentedLogicalOrListOpen
snippet.statement: Description: Text used at the beginning of a top level indented logical or list.

snippet.name: TopLevelIndentedLogicalOrListPairSeparator
snippet.statement: Description: Used to separate items in a top level indented logical or list. Format: \n or

snippet.name: TopLevelIndentedLogicalOrListSeparator
snippet.statement: Description: Used to separate items in a top level indented logical or list. Format: \n or

snippet.name: UniversalQuantifier
snippet.statement: Description: Used for 'each' before an object name to signify the quantity associated with the object. Format: each {0}

snippet.name: ValueTypeVerbalization
snippet.statement: Description: Verbalizes an object as being a value type. Format: {0} is a value type

snippet.name: VariableExistence
snippet.statement: Description: Assert variable existence as a complete statement, as opposed to the VariableIntroductionClause used to introduce a variable using a prefix. Format: {0} exists

snippet.name: VariableIntroductionClause
snippet.statement: Description: Introduce variables inline in the verbalization phrase. The replacement is either a single value or a list, and the quantifiers (some, no, that) are already included in the replacement list. Format: for {0},

snippet.name: VariableIntroductionSeparator
snippet.statement: Description: The list separator for introducing multiple variables in a single clause. Format: and

snippet.name: VerbalizerCloseVerbalization
snippet.statement: Description: Used by the verbalizer to close a verbalization opened by VerbalizerOpenVerbalization

snippet.name: VerbalizerDecreaseIndent
snippet.statement: Description: Used by the verbalizer to close indent opened by VerbalizerIncreaseIndent

snippet.name: VerbalizerDocumentFooter
snippet.statement: Description: Used by the verbalizer to close a document

snippet.name: VerbalizerDocumentHeader
snippet.statement: Description: Used by the verbalizer to open a document. The document header gets replacement fields in the following order: {0} font-family {1} font-size {2} predicate text color {3} predicate text bold {4} object name color {5} object name bold {6} formal item color {7} formal item bold {8} note color {9} note bold {10} reference mode color {11} reference mode bold {12} instance value color {13} instance value bold

snippet.name: VerbalizerFontWeightBold
snippet.statement: Description: The text to insert to indicate a bold font.

snippet.name: VerbalizerFontWeightNormal
snippet.statement: Description: The text to insert to indicate a normal font weight.

snippet.name: VerbalizerIncreaseIndent
snippet.statement: Description: Used by the verbalizer to indent a child verbalization

snippet.name: VerbalizerNewLine
snippet.statement: Description: Used by the verbalizer to enter a new line. Format: \n

snippet.name: VerbalizerOpenVerbalization
snippet.statement: Description: Used by the verbalizer around a single verbalization

snippet.name: XorLeadListOpen
snippet.unformattedSnippet: exactly one of the following is true:

snippet.name: XorNestedListCollapsedOpen
snippet.unformattedSnippet: exactly one of the following is true:

snippet.name: XorNestedListOpen
snippet.unformattedSnippet: exactly one of the following is true:

snippet.name: XorTailListCollapsedOpen
snippet.unformattedSnippet: exactly one of the following is true:

snippet.name: XorTailListOpen
snippet.unformattedSnippet: exactly one of the following is true:
